page.title: 05WALSDEN Industry
page.content: Around the beginning of the nineteenth century saw the start of the cotton industry in the Walsden valley, which developed throughout the century with the building of the cotton mills. Transport for these was provided first by the canal system, which was the first canal route linking Yorkshire with Lancashire and later by the railway system. During this century the cotton has declined and so the pattern of industry in the valley has changed. Some of the mill buildings are still in use but have been divided into smaller units, so that various smaller firms use the premises the majority of the existing industries in this valley have been developed since the war and cover a wide range of products.
